topic_metadata.title: How do I use font variants, e.g., Condensed Medium?

posts.name: Timo
posts.cooked: I have font styles installed locally that are not found by Typst even when I include the font path. For example, Typst recognises Futura but not styles such as Futura-CondensedMedium, which is available in Apple Font Book. How can I use such font styles?
posts.raw: I have font styles installed locally that are not found by Typst even when I include the font path. For example, Typst recognises Futura but not styles such as Futura-CondensedMedium, which is available in Apple Font Book. How can I use such font styles?

posts.name: Pascal Quach
posts.cooked:
This is the correct behaviour. Typst recognises Futura and all variants.
You have to change text(stretch), and change text(weight) to “medium”.

I have changed your topic title, if it does not match your question, please change it again to a more appropriate one!
posts.raw:
This is the correct behaviour. Typst recognises Futura and all variants. 
You have to change [`text(stretch)`](https://typst.app/docs/reference/text/text/#parameters-stretch), and change [`text(weight)`](https://typst.app/docs/reference/text/text/#parameters-weight) to "medium".

I have changed your topic title, if it does not match your question, please change it again to a more appropriate one!
